metadata.name: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands
metadata.comment: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('hctac')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('kaerb')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('dnammoc')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ekovn')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('elifd')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('rahc')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('etirw')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('golon')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tninon')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('eddih')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tpircs')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ssecorp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('llehsrewop')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('esnopser')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('daolnwod')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tneilcbew')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tneilc')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ptth')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('elifotevas')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('46esab')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('htappmetteg')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tcejbo')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('maerts')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('hcaerof')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('retupmoc'))) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -encodedcommand ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -enc '))))

output.summary: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers
